div.p: Plugin Version @PLUGIN_VERSION@

KVM (for Kernel-based Virtual Machine) is a full virtualization solution for Linux on x86 hardware with virtualization extensions (Intel VT or AMD-V). KVM consists of a loadable kernel module, kvm.ko, which provides the core virtualization infrastructure and a processor-specific module, kvm-intel.ko or kvm-amd.ko. KVM also requires a modified QEMU.
This plugin uses the virtualization API libvirt, and command-line tools such as virt-install, virt-clone, virt-image, and virsh to accomplish tasks, which means you must install these packages.

More information can be found at:
Kernel Based Virtual Machine home page
The virtualization API
Virtual Machine Manager

@PLUGIN_KEY@ implements the most important virtualization actions. It performs actions on Virtual Machines like Clean Up resources, Clone, Create, Create Resources From the Virtual Machines, Destroy, List, Reboot, Resume, Revert to a specific Snapshot, Shutdown , Snapshot, Start, Suspend and Undefine.

Electric Commander itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes, combo buttons, historical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of the log been generated, among others.
This plugin was developed and tested with KVM kernel 2.6.32.

Packages:
qemu-kvm 0.12.1.2-2.160
qemu-kvm-tools 0.12.1.2-2
libvirt 0.8.7
virtinst 0.500.6
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.
Deletes ElectricCommander resources and optionally undefines the virtual machines on the KVM server.

tr.td: kvm_delete_vm
Provide the members(IP with its port) to add it to the new pool, more than one member can be specified, different members must be separated by a space between them.
kvm_number_of_vms
Indicate the number of virtual machines to clean up. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
kvm_timeout
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.
kvm_vmname
The name of the Load Balancing Pool that is going to be created. (Required)

div.p: Creates one or more clones of a virtual machine.
- Command to be executed: b pool <pool_name> delete

tr.td: kvm_number_of_clones
Indicate the number of clones to create. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to cloned VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the clone number ('_#').
kvm_original_vmname
Provide the name of the virtual machine to clone. (Required)
kvm_timeout
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.
kvm_vmname
Name the virtual machine that will be created. (Required)

div.p: Creates virtual machines on the KVM server.

tr.td: kvm_cpu_arch
Indicate the CPU architecture of the virtual machine to be created. The default is i386. (Required)
kvm_device_type
Provide the type of the device to use if the storage method selected is 'pool'. The default is 'disk'.
kvm_disk_format
Select the format of the storage. The default is 'qcow2'. If you use the 'diskfile' storage method, some formats will not work (use 'raw').
kvm_disk_path
Provide the path of the virtual disk to use if the storage method selected is 'diskfile'.
kvm_disksize
Indicate the capacity of the virtual disk (in GB). The default is 4. (Required)
kvm_guest_type
Provide the guest operating system type. The default is 'none'.
kvm_install_method
Select the operating system installation method.
kvm_install_source_path
Path to a location containing an installable distribution. (Required)
kvm_memory
Indicate the size of the virtual machine's memory (in MB). The default is 512. (Required)
kvm_network
Provide the network name or bridge device name.
kvm_network_type
Select the type of network to use. The default is 'bridge'.
kvm_num_cpus
Indicate the number of virtual processors in a virtual machine. The default is 1. (Required)
kvm_number_of_vms
Indicate the number of virtual machines to create. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
kvm_pool_name
Provide the name of the storage pool to use if the storage method selected is 'pool'. (Required)
kvm_storage_method
Select a storage method to use. The default is 'pool'.(Required)
kvm_timeout
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.
kvm_vmname
Provide the name the virtual machine to be created. (Required)
kvm_vnclisten_ip
Provide the host operating system IP address, to listen to for the VNC connection. Blank means the host's address.
